title: Brewers ink five to one-year contracts
subtitle: Brewers ink five to one-year deals
body: The Milwaukee Brewers signed five players to one-year Major League contracts on Monday, including outfielder Drew Anderson, first baseman Brad Nelson and pitchers Tim Dillard, Manny Parra and Luis Pena.  Anderson, 26, batted .273 in 108 games last season at Triple-A Nashville with four homers, 28 doubles and three triples.  Nelson, a fourth-round pick in the 2001 First-Year Player Draft, hit .263 in 116 games with 20 homers, 23 doubles and 65 RBIs at Nashville. Dillard was 8-4 with a 4.74 ERA in 34 games, including 16 starts, for Nashville. He struck out 62 over 133 innings. The right-hander also pitched for the Mesa Solar Sox in the Arizona Fall League and was 1-0 with a 6.52 ERA in 11 relief appearances.   Parra, 25, pitched at the Double-A, Triple-A and big league levels last season. He was 7-3 with a 2.68 ERA at Double-A Huntsville, and made four starts for Nashville, going 1-3 with a 1.73 ERA. The left-hander was 0-1 with a 3.76 ERA in nine games, including two starts, for the Brewers.   Pena was a combined 5-4 with a 2.63 ERA for Double-A Huntsville and Class A Brevard County last year. The right-hander was 5-0 with a 2.08 ERA with the Class A team and 0-4 with a 2.89 ERA at Huntsville. This winter, Pena pitched in Venezuela and appeared in 13 games, posting a 4.50 ERA. Carrie Muskat is a reporter for MLB.com. This story was not subject to the approval of Major League Baseball or its clubs.
author: Carrie Muskat
